messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] What a piece of work!
messages.msgSnippet: ** I ll never forget that this Shakespearean  piece was in Hair because it s the song they chant during the infamous get naked scene, that MIGHTILY
messages.messageBody:
**
I'll never forget that this Shakespearean piece was in "Hair" because
it's the song they chant during the infamous "get naked" scene, that
MIGHTILY
embarrassed me and my best friend Juli, when we were 13...not because we
didn't know it was coming, NOT because we were sitting in the first row
when
those live naked people got up there on stage, but because we had to
come
with (bummer! <g>) her mother---who had the NERVE to not even blush,
dang it!**


Becky!!!!!!

If we ever get to meet in person, maybe we could drink too much wine and
sing all the songs from Hair.

Betsy

messages.subject: What a piece of work!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/20/2002 2:22:08 PM Central Daylight Time, ... I ll never forget that this Shakespearean  piece was in Hair because it s the song they
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/20/2002 2:22:08 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I don't know because I learned all the Hair song lyrics listening to the
> album in olden days, **before video was invented**. That's what I
> remembered the "what a piece of work is man" stuff from. I've never
> seen the movie.

I'll never forget that this Shakespearean piece was in "Hair" because
it's the song they chant during the infamous "get naked" scene, that MIGHTILY
embarrassed me and my best friend Juli, when we were 13...not because we
didn't know it was coming, NOT because we were sitting in the first row when
those live naked people got up there on stage, but because we had to come
with (bummer! <g>) her mother---who had the NERVE to not even blush, dang it!

Becky in Iowa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
